intro: Minuartia setacea, commonly known as the silky rockcress, is a low-growing flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pink. The plant features slender, hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Minuartia setacea is a hardy species that is well adapted to harsh, cold climates.
